Sentence.sentence: You know, one of the first things I like to tell people when they ask me about the supplements, is that a lot of them are promoted as a cure for your memory, but your memory doesn’t need a cure.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: What your memory needs is a good workout.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: So really, those supplements aren’t going to give you that perfect memory in the way that they promise.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Is there really a magic memory pill or a herbal recall remedy? I have been frequently asked if these memory supplements work.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Carr points out, that after spending time in quiet rural settings, subjects "exhibit greater attentiveness, stronger memory and generally improved cognition.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They tend to forget past unhappy memories and focus on their present needs .
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Bernard Jackson is a free man today, but he has many bitter memories.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: He has better memories of childhood
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: What a terrible memory you have!
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Another study also found eating a high-fat and high-sugar breakfast each day for as little as four days resulted in problems with learning and memory similar to those observed in overweight and obese individuals.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: But thinking about or remembering descriptions in terms of their social meaning activated the dorsomedial prefrontal cortex—part of the brain's social network—even as traditional memory regions registered low levels of activity.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: For example, one study found healthy adults assigned to a high-fat diet for five days showed impaired attention, memory, and mood compared with a low-fat diet control group.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: For most of us, the best plan is to take in new information in the morning and then try to consolidate it into memory during the afternoon.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Instead of narrowing our focus, like negative emotions do, positive emotions affect our brains in ways that increase our awareness, attention and memory.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: More recently, as he reported in a 2012 review, lieberman has discovered that this region may be part of a distinct network involved in socially motivated learning and memory.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Recent research has also shown that indulging in a high-fat and high-sugar diet may have negative effects on your brain, causing learning and memory deficits.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: So it is not really your memory letting you down—just your ability to retrieve information from it.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: So really, those supplements aren't going to give you that perfect memory in the way that they promise.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Studies have found obesity is associated with impairments in cognitive functioning, as assessed by a range of learning and memory tests, such as the ability to remember a list of words presented some minutes or hours earlier.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Take plenty of breaks, because they offer a double bonus: the time off gives your mind a chance to do some preliminary consolidation and it also gives a memory boost to the learning.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The study also found that when subjects thought about and later recalled descriptions in terms of their informational content, regions associated with factual memory, such as the medial temporal lobe, became active.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: When you have done this, try to organize your life so that the time set aside for learning coincides with the time when your memory is at its best.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: You have to wait for the speaker to deliver quite a chunk of language before you then put it into the second language, which puts your short-term memory under intense stress.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: You know, one of the first things I like to tell people when they ask me about the supplements, is that a lot of them are promoted as a cure for your memory, but your memory doesn't need a cure.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+memor记忆+able……的→大家该一起记住→值得纪念的
im不+memor记忆+ial……的→不能记得的→远古的
memor记忆+andum东西→帮助记的东西→备忘录

stems_affixes.value_cn: 记忆,记忆力;回忆;存储[器]
stems_affixes.word_buile: memor记忆+y状态,性质→n.记忆,记忆力;回忆;存储[器]
re再+membr=memor记忆+ance表名词→n.记得,记忆
com共同+memor记住+ate表动词→大家一起记住→纪念

stems_affixes.value_cn: 记住;[to]转达问候,代……致意,代……问好
stems_affixes.word_buile: re再+member=memor记忆→再记得→回忆,记忆

word_mean: 记忆〔力〕：回顾感觉，印象和思念的智能

Sentence.sentence: A common memory they all have of their school days is the school uniform.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语福建卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: According to sparrow, we are not becoming people with poor memories as a result of the Internet.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Among the works and masterworks on exhibition the visitor will find the best pieces, most importantly the persistence of memory.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Even in its current state, the Internet has extended my memory and judgment.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: For each of those gardens, write down the strongest memory you have.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: I must have always known reading was very important because the first memories I have as a child deal with books.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: In transactive memory, people remember how to find the information.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 阅读理解 阅读C 题设

Sentence.sentence: Instead, computer users are developing stronger transactive memories; that is, people are learning how to organize huge quantities of information so that they are able to access it at a later date.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: It's as if the brain is preserving its most important memories.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解  七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Memory is sometimes a tricky thing.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 七选五 选项

Sentence.sentence: More generally, the Internet functions as if it were my memory.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: One idea is that sleep helps us strengthen new memories.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解  七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: She and her research team wanted to know the Internet is changing memory.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Support is growing for a theory that sleep evolved so that connections between neurons in the brain can be weakened overnight, making room for fresh memories to form the next day.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解  七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: The processes take place to stop our brains becoming loaded with memories.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解  七选五 选项

Sentence.sentence: Their research also suggests how we may build lasting memories over time even though the synapses become thinner.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解  七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Then go outside and work out a plan to translate your childhood memories into your grown-up garden.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: This doesn't mean we are becoming either more or less intelligent, but there is no doubt that the way we use memory is changing.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: This is called " transactive memory".
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: We have poorer memories than before.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: We know that, while awake, fresh memories are recorded by reinforcing connections between brain cells, but the memory processes that take place while we sleep have been unclear.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解  七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: We tend to have a better memory for things that excite our senses or appeal to our emotions than for straight facts.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: We'd also like to visit graceland, the popular museum in memory of elvis presley.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷2 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: As many people hit middle age, they often start to notice that their memory and mental clarity are not what they used to be.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: The Web-based program allows you to systematically improve your memory and attention skills.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: We believe that if animals ran the labs, they would test us to determine the limits of our patience, our faithfulness, our memory for locations.
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

entry.def: Your memory is your ability to remember things.

example.ex: All the details of the meeting are fresh in my memory...
example.tran: 我对会议的所有细节都记忆犹新。

example.ex: He'd a good memory for faces, and he was sure he hadn't seen her before...
example.tran: 他对别人的长相过目不忘，他确信自己以前没有见过她。

entry.def: A memory is something that you remember from the past.
entry.tran: 记忆;记忆中的事物;回忆

example.ex: She cannot bear to watch the film because of the bad memories it brings back...
example.tran: 她看不了那部电影，因为它会勾起一些痛苦的回忆。

example.ex: Her earliest memory is of singing at the age of four to wounded soldiers...
example.tran: 她最早的记忆是在4岁时为受伤的战士唱歌。

entry.def: A computer's memory is the part of the computer where information is stored, especially for a short time before it is transferred to disks or magnetic tapes.

example.ex: The data are stored in the computer's memory.
example.tran: 资料存在计算机内存里。

entry.def: If you talk about the memory of someone who has died, especially someone who was loved or respected, you are referring to the thoughts, actions, and ceremonies by which they are remembered.

example.ex: She remained devoted to his memory...
The congress opened with a minute's silence in memory of those who died in the struggle.
example.tran: 代表大会开幕时进行了一分钟的默哀，以怀念在斗争中牺牲的人。

entry.def: If you do something from memory, for example speak the words of a poem or play a piece of music, you do it without looking at it, because you know it very well.

example.ex: Many members of the church sang from memory...
example.tran: 许多教徒都是凭记忆唱颂歌。

example.ex: Children write down the word, cover it up and then try to spell it from memory.
example.tran: 孩子们把这个词写下来蒙住，然后试着凭记忆拼出来。

entry.def: If you say that something is, for example, the best, worst, or first thing of its kind in living memory, you are emphasizing that it is the only thing of that kind that people can remember.
entry.tran: 在人们的记忆中（最…的事情）

example.ex: The floods are the worst in living memory...
example.tran: 那次洪水是人们记忆中最严重的一次。

example.ex: No-one in living memory has come back from that place alive.
example.tran: 在人们的记忆中，没有人从那个地方生还。

entry.def: If you lose your memory, you forget things that you used to know.

example.ex: His illness caused him to lose his memory.

sentences.sentence: "search as he would, the memory was lost"

means.word_mean: 2. the cognitive processes whereby past experience is remembered;
3. the power of retaining and recalling past experience;

sentences.sentence: "he had a good memory when he was younger"
"a memory and the CPU form the central part of a computer to which peripherals are attached"

means.word_mean: 5. the area of cognitive psychology that studies memory processes;

sentences.sentence: "he taught a graduate course on learning and memory"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French memorie, from Latin memoria, from memor 'mindful, remembering'

means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 梅默里 Mowbray的变体

sentences.cn: 我不善于记名字。
sentences.en: I have a bad memory for names.

sentences.cn: 人是健忘的。
sentences.en: People have short memories (= they soon forget) .

sentences.cn: 谁让他失望，他总是记恨在心。
sentences.en: He had a long memory for people who had disappointed him.

sentences.cn: 她能背诵全诗。
sentences.en: She can recite the whole poem from memory .

sentences.cn: 事故之后他有几个星期失去记忆。
sentences.en: He suffered loss of memory for weeks after the accident.

sentences.cn: 你肯定吗？记忆也会捉弄人的。
sentences.en: Are you sure? Memory can play tricks on you.

sentences.cn: 在我的记忆里，这个国家从没太平过。
sentences.en: There hasn't been peace in the country in/within my memory .

sentences.cn: 最近能记得的风暴中，这是最厉害的一次。
sentences.en: It was the worst storm in recent memory.

sentences.cn: 在世的人都不记得发生过这样的事。
sentences.en: This hasn't happened in living memory (= nobody alive now can remember it happening) .

sentences.cn: 童年的回忆
sentences.en: childhood memories

sentences.cn: 我依然清楚地记得我的祖父母。

sentences.cn: 你最早能记得的是什么？
sentences.en: What is your earliest memory?

sentences.cn: 这些照片唤起了许多美好的回忆。
sentences.en: The photos bring back lots of good memories .

sentences.cn: 我们永远怀念她。
sentences.en: Her memory lives on (= we still remember her) .

sentences.en: He founded the charity in memory of his late wife.

sentences.en: All the details of the meeting are fresh in my memory...

sentences.en: Her earliest memory is of singing at the age of four to wounded soldiers...

sentences.cn: 许多教徒都是凭记忆唱颂歌。
sentences.en: Many members of the church sang from memory...

sentences.cn: 孩子们把这个词写下来蒙住，然后试着凭记忆拼出来。
sentences.en: Children write down the word, cover it up and then try to spell it from memory.

sentences.cn: 那次洪水是人们记忆中最严重的一次。
sentences.en: The floods are the worst in living memory...

sentences.cn: 在人们的记忆中，没有人从那个地方生还。
sentences.en: No-one in living memory has come back from that place alive.

sentences.cn: 我们认为，假如动物掌管了实验室，它们会对我们进行测试，以确定我们的忍耐度、忠诚度以及方位记忆力。
sentences.en: We believe that if animals ran the labs, they would test us to determine the limits of our patience, our faithfulness, our memory for locations.

sentences.cn: 很多人在步入中年后发现，他们的记忆力和思维清晰度往往不如从前。
sentences.en: As many people hit middle age, they often start to notice that their memory and mental clarity are not what they used to be.

sentences.cn: 随着时间的流逝，这些体验通常会变得更加珍贵——以记忆或故事的形式——尤 其是当它们让人感觉到自己与他人联系更紧密时。
sentences.en: These purchases often become more valuable with time — as stories or memories — particularly if they involve feeling more connected to others.

sentences.cn: 是否真有神奇的记忆药丸，或者帮助回忆的草药？经常有人问我，这些记忆力保健品是否有用。
sentences.en: Is there really a magic memory pill or a herbal recall remedy? I have been frequently asked if these memory supplements work.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 要知道，人们问我关于这类保健品的事时，我首先想告诉他们的事之一就是：很多保健品宣传自己是用来治疗记忆力的，但是记忆力并不需要治疗。
sentences.en: You know, one of the first things I like to tell people when they ask me about the supplements, is that a lot of them are promoted as a cure for your memory, but your memory doesn’t need a cure.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 记忆力需要的是良好的锻炼。
sentences.en: What your memory needs is a good workout.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 所以说真的，那些保健品不会像商家保证的那样给你完美的记忆力。
sentences.en: So really, those supplements aren’t going to give you that perfect memory in the way that they promise.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 1关于大多数记忆力保健品，叙述者说了什么？。
sentences.en: What does the speaker say about most memory supplements?.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 因此，让你失望的其实并不是你的记忆力，而只不过是从大脑中检索信息的能力。
sentences.en: So it is not really your memory letting you down—just your ability to retrieve information from it.
sentences.from: 17年6月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 如果我们对自己的记忆力更有自信，并且知道如何合理使用记忆力，我们就能记住更多更多的东西。
sentences.en: We would remember a lot more if we had more confidence in our memories and knew how to use them properly.
sentences.from: 17年6月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 对于大多数人来说，最好的规划就是在上午吸收新信息，然后在下午尽量将其融入记忆中。
sentences.en: For most of us, the best plan is to take in new information in the morning and then try to consolidate it into memory during the afternoon.
sentences.from: 17年6月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 消极情绪会限制我们的注意力，而积极情绪则通过加强意识、提高注意力和记忆力的方式影响我们的大脑。
sentences.en: Instead  of  narrowing  our  focus,  like  negative  emotions  do,  positive  emotions  affect our brains in ways that increase our awareness, attention  and  memory
sentences.from: 16年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 同时，暂时性的记忆力下降通常会在 37 岁左右变得明显起来
sentences.en: Dips in memory, meanwhile, generally became apparent around age 37
sentences.from: 16年6月四级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 体育活动可促进向大脑的血液 (33) 流动，增强记忆力、注意力和创造力，这些对学习是 (34) 至关重要的。
sentences.en: Physical activity can improve blood 33 flow to the brain, fueling memory, attention and creativity, which are 34 essential to learning.
sentences.from: 16年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 消费者，至少是美国的消费者，由于对近年来的大萧条还记忆犹新，所以会谨慎处理在加油站省下的钱。
sentences.en: Consumers, in the U.S. at least, are acting cautiously with the savings they’re getting at the gas pump, as the memory of the recent great recession is still fresh in their mind.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 尽管他的记忆力一向不错，但是年少爱情带来的兴奋感似乎改变了他的大脑：自此，他开始记住生活的每个细节。
sentences.en: He had always had a good memory, but the thrill of young love seems to have shifted a gear in his mind: from now on, he would start recording his whole life in detail.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 21 世纪初，因为一个名为Jill Price 的年轻女性的出现，人们首次认识到了“超级自传体记忆”（或简称为HSAM）的存在。
sentences.en: ‘Highly superior autobiographical memory’ (or HSAM for short), first came to light in the early 2000s, with a young woman named Jill Price.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 很显然，世间并不存在什么“完美的”记忆力——他们这些非凡的头脑所利用的记忆工具和我们的一样，也是有缺陷的。
sentences.en: Clearly, there is no such thing as a “perfect” memory – their extraordinary minds are still using the same flawed tools that the rest of us rely on.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 大脑看起来似乎是一座浩瀚无际的图书馆，里面的书架上存放着我们最珍贵的记忆和一生积累的知识。
sentences.en: The brain is a seemingly endless library, whose shelves house our most precious memories as well as our lifetime’s knowledge.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 信息并不是一味涌入大脑的，相反，旧信息有时会被挤出大脑，以腾出位置让新记忆形成。
sentences.en: Instead of just crowding in, old information is sometimes pushed out of the brain for new memories to form.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 我们认为，假如动物掌管了实验室，它们会对我们进行测试，以确定我们的忍耐度、忠诚度以及方位记忆力。
sentences.en: We believe that if animals ran the labs, they would test us to determine the limits of our patience, our faithfulness, our memory for locations.

sentences.cn: 很多人在步入中年后发现，他们的记忆力和思维清晰度往往不如从前。
sentences.en: As many people hit middle age, they often start to notice that their memory and mental clarity are not what they used to be.

sentences.cn: 是否真有神奇的记忆药丸，或者帮助回忆的草药？经常有人问我，这些记忆力保健品是否有用。
sentences.en: Is there really a magic memory pill or a herbal recall remedy? I have been frequently asked if these memory supplements work.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 要知道，人们问我关于这类保健品的事时，我首先想告诉他们的事之一就是：很多保健品宣传自己是用来治疗记忆力的，但是记忆力并不需要治疗。
sentences.en: You know, one of the first things I like to tell people when they ask me about the supplements, is that a lot of them are promoted as a cure for your memory, but your memory doesn’t need a cure.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 记忆力需要的是良好的锻炼。
sentences.en: What your memory needs is a good workout.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 所以说真的，那些保健品不会像商家保证的那样给你完美的记忆力。
sentences.en: So really, those supplements aren’t going to give you that perfect memory in the way that they promise.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 1关于大多数记忆力保健品，叙述者说了什么？。

sentences.cn: 因此，让你失望的其实并不是你的记忆力，而只不过是从大脑中检索信息的能力。
sentences.en: So it is not really your memory letting you down—just your ability to retrieve information from it.

sentences.cn: 如果我们对自己的记忆力更有自信，并且知道如何合理使用记忆力，我们就能记住更多更多的东西。
